page.title: 19THE WILDFOWL TRUST
page.content: Although the Slimbridge Wildfowl Trust is just outside the area surveyed it is of great importance to the locality. As one of Gloucestershire's major tourist attractions the Trust brings many people through the villages of Slimbridge and Cambridge each year and provides employment and revenue for many inhabitants of the villages - as well as causing occasional traffic problems! The many species of bird visiting the Trust can often be seen closer to the villages and include Canada Geese, Snow Geese, Pink-footed Geese, Purple Sandpipers, Sandwich Terns, Redwings and Peregrine Falcons. However, the best facilities for viewing these and other birds are to be found at the Trust.
